basics.name: Tinghui Zhu
basics.label: CS Master Student at Fudan University

publications.name: How Easily do Irrelevant Inputs Skew the Responses of Large Language Models?
publications.summary: We present a comprehensive investigation into the robustness of LLMs to different types of irrelevant information under various conditions.

publications.name: TravelPlanner: A Benchmark for Real-World Planning with Language Agents
publications.summary: We propose TravelPlanner, a new planning benchmark that focuses on travel planning, a common real-world planning scenario. It provides a rich sandbox environment, various tools for accessing nearly four million data records, and 1,225 meticulously curated planning intents and reference plans.

publications.name: Deductive Beam Search: Decoding Deducible Rationale for Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
publications.summary: Deductive Beam Search, constrained by the principle of deductive reasoning, integrates CoT with step-wise beam search to guide reasoning towards a deducible path.

publications.name: Towards Visual Taxonomy Expansion
publications.summary: We propose Visual Taxonomy Expansion (VTE), introducing visual features into the taxonomy expansion task.

publications.name: SLR:A Million-Scale Comprehensive Crossword Dataset for Simultaneous Learning and Reasoning
publications.summary: We propose a novel crossword-based NLU task that imparts knowledge information to a model by solving crossword clues and simultaneously trains the model to infer new knowledge from existing knowledge.

publications.name: End-to-End Entity Linking with Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
publications.summary: We propose to model the Entity Linking task as a hierarchical decision-making process and design a hierarchical reinforcement learning algorithm to solve the problem.
